workingTogether.title: Working Together to End Hunger
workingTogether.text: According to the World Food Programme, 135 million suffer from acute hunger largely due to man-made conflicts, climate change and economic downturns. The COVID-19 pandemic could now double that number, putting an additional 130 million people at risk of suffering acute hunger by the end of 2020. With more than a quarter of a billion people potentially at the brink of starvation, swift action needs to be taken to provide food and humanitarian relief to the most at-risk regions.

card.title4: Donator buy the coupon in the website
card.title5: The person in need can eat without asking in available restaurants
card.title6: The restaurant delete the used coupon in the website

footer.summary: Food On Coupon is a platform which donators can donate food coupons to people in need from the chosen restaurants.
